wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Percy Homer (April 1886 – ?) was an English footballer who played as a forward. Born in Winson Green, Warwickshire. He played for Soho Caledonians, Erdington, Aston Villa, Stourbridge, Kidderminster Harriers and Manchester United.

response: Tom Homer (born 1 April 1990) is an English former rugby union player who recently played at centre, wing and fullback for London Irish in Premiership Rugby. He was a member of the Grand Slam winning England U18 side in 2008 and was a member of the England U20 squad in January 2008.

Homer also kicked two penalties in the Exiles' 38–17 win over Worcester on 15 March 2009,London Irish 38–17 Worcester and kicked eight from eight (six penalties and two conversions) against Northampton Saints on 22 March 2009.London Irish 37–27 NorthamptonTom Homer leads London Irish to victory At the start of the 2012-13 Premiership campaign Homer stated that he wanted to be known for more than just his kicking and was looking to get more involved and to use the opportunity of the attacking blueprint of coach Brian Smith to do so. Homer cites former England centre Mike Catt as a major influence.Homer reveals in Premiership life
* Tom Homer (rugby union) (born 1990), English rugby union player
